ADC_CONFIGURE_MESSAGE0: configure ADC on pin $[PIN] with attenuation $[ATTEN]
ADC_CONFIGURE_TOOLTIP: Configure the ADC on the specified pin with the given attenuation
ADC_READ_TOOLTIP: Read the ADC value from the specified pin
CONTROL_EXIT_TOOLTIP: Exit the program with the specified exit code
CONTROL_DATENOW_TOOLTIP: Get the current time in milliseconds since the program started
GPIO_PINMODE_TOOLTIP: Set the mode of the specified pin
GPIO_WRITE_TOOLTIP: Write a digital value to the specified pin
GPIO_READ_TOOLTIP: Read the digital value from the specified pin
GPIO_ONEVENT_TOOLTIP: Set an event handler for the specified pin and event type
GPIO_OFFEVENT_TOOLTIP: Remove the event handler for the specified pin and event type
I2C_CONSTRUCTOR_MESSAGE0:
create $[CONSTRUCTED_VAR_NAME] on $[I2C] with
 SDA pin $[SDA] SCL pin $[SCL]
 bitrate $[BITRATE]
I2C_CONSTRUCTOR_TOOLTIP: Setup the I2C bus with specified SDA and SCL pins and bitrate
I2C_LABEL_IN_FUTURE_RELEASES: I2C Read/Write will be added in future releases.
STORAGE_DESCRIPTION: Key value storage blocks for storing key-value pairs in non-volatile storage.
KV_OPEN_TOOLTIP: Initialize an Key Value Storage namespace
KV_SET_STRING_MESSAGE0: set KV $[KV_INSTANCE] key $[KEY] to string value $[VALUE]
KV_SET_STRING_TOOLTIP: Set a string value in NVS for the specified key
KV_SET_NUMBER_MESSAGE0: set KV $[KV_INSTANCE] key $[KEY] to number value $[VALUE]
KV_SET_NUMBER_TOOLTIP: Set a number value in NVS for the specified key
KV_GET_STRING_TOOLTIP: Get a string value from NVS for the specified key
KV_GET_NUMBER_TOOLTIP: Get a number value from NVS for the specified key
KV_ERASE_TOOLTIP: Erase the specified key from NVS
KV_EXISTS_TOOLTIP: Check if the specified key exists in NVS
KV_COMMIT_TOOLTIP: Commit any pending changes to NVS
LEDC_CONFIGURETIMER_MESSAGE0: configure timer $[TIMER] with frequency $[FREQUENCY] Hz and resolution $[RESOLUTION] bits (default 10 bits)
LEDC_CONFIGURETIMER_TOOLTIP: Configure the given timer with specified frequency and resolution
LEDC_CONFIGURECHANNEL_MESSAGE0: configure channel $[CHANNEL] on pin $[PIN] with timer $[TIMER] and duty $[DUTY] (0-1023)
LEDC_CONFIGURECHANNEL_TOOLTIP: Configure the given channel on specified pin with timer and duty cycle
LEDC_SETFREQUENCY_MESSAGE0: set frequency of timer $[TIMER] to $[FREQUENCY] Hz
LEDC_SETFREQUENCY_TOOLTIP: Set the frequency of the given timer
LEDC_SETDUTY_TOOLTIP: Set the duty of the given channel
MOTOR_CONSTRUCTOR_PINS_MESSAGE0: motor pins motA $[MOT_A] motB $[MOT_B] encA $[ENC_A] encB $[ENC_B]
MOTOR_CONSTRUCTOR_REGPARAMS_MESSAGE0:
reg params kp $[KP] ki $[KI] kd $[KD]
 kv $[KV] ka $[KA] kc $[KC]
 maxIOut $[MAX_IOUT]
 unwindFactor $[UNWIND_FACTOR] (defaults to 0)
MOTOR_CONSTRUCTOR_MESSAGE0:
create $[CONSTRUCTED_VAR_NAME] motor with 
pins $[PINS]
LEDC $[LEDC]
reg params $[REG_PARAMS]
 encoder ticks $[ENC_TICKS] circumference $[CIRCUMFERENCE] (mm)
MOTOR_SETSPEED_TOOLTIP: Set the speed of the motor
MOTOR_SETRAMP_TOOLTIP: Set the speed ramp of the motor
MOTOR_MOVE_TOOLTIP: Move the motor for the specified distance
MOTOR_MOVE_TIME_TOOLTIP: Move the motor for the specified time
MOTOR_SETRAW_MESSAGE0: set raw power of $[MOTOR_INSTANCE] to $[POWER] (-1023 to 1023)
MOTOR_SETRAW_TOOLTIP: Set raw power to the motor
MOTOR_GETPOSITION_TOOLTIP: Get the position of the motor
PC_CONSTRUCTOR_MESSAGE0:
create $[CONSTRUCTED_VAR_NAME] pulse counter
 on level pin $[PIN_LEVEL] edge pin $[PIN_EDGE]
 with level low action $[LEVEL_LOW_ACTION]
 level high action $[LEVEL_HIGH_ACTION]
 edge positive action $[EDGE_POS_ACTION]
 edge negative action $[EDGE_NEG_ACTION]
PC_CONSTRUCTOR_TOOLTIP: Create a new Pulse Counter instance
PC_READ_TOOLTIP: Read the current value of the pulse counter
SR_BEGIN_TOOLTIP: Initialize the SimpleRadio on the specified group
SR_SENDKEYVALUE_TOOLTIP: Send a key-value pair via SimpleRadio
SR_ONRECEIVENUMBER_TOOLTIP: Register a callback for receiving numbers via SimpleRadio. Use the receivedNumber block inside to access the value.
SR_ONRECEIVESTRING_TOOLTIP: Register a callback for receiving strings via SimpleRadio. Use the receivedString block inside to access the value.
SR_ONRECEIVEKEYVALUE_TOOLTIP: Register a callback for receiving key-value pairs via SimpleRadio. Use the receivedKey, receivedValue blocks inside to access the values.
SR_OFFRECEIVE_TOOLTIP: Unregister the callback for the specified SimpleRadio packet type
STRIP_CONSTRUCTOR_MESSAGE0: create $[CONSTRUCTED_VAR_NAME] strip on pin $[LED_PIN] with $[LED_COUNT] LEDs of type $[LED_TYPE]
STRIP_CONSTRUCTOR_TOOLTIP: Create a new Smart LED strip instance
STRIP_SET_TOOLTIP: Set the LED at the specified index to the given color
STRIP_SHOW_TOOLTIP: Update the LED strip to show the set colors
STRIP_GET_TOOLTIP: Get the color of the LED at the specified index
STRIP_CLEAR_TOOLTIP: Clear the LED strip (set all LEDs to off)
WIFI_CURRENTIP_TOOLTIP: Get the current IP address of the WiFi connection
WIFI_WAITFORCONNECTION_TOOLTIP: Wait until the device is connected to a WiFi network
